entities.name: Kronos
entities.description: Pre-Greek god, little worshipped in classical times with a harvest festival called Kronia.

entities.name: Rhea
entities.description: Consort of Kronos, associated with the legend of hiding her son Zeus from Kronos.

entities.name: Kronia
entities.description: A harvest festival where social distinctions were temporarily abolished, celebrated in Athens, Rhodes, and Thebes.

entities.name: Saturn
entities.description: Identified by Roman theorists as the equivalent of Kronos.

entities.name: Zeus
entities.description: Youngest child of Kronos and Rhea, hidden from Kronos and later overthrew him.

entities.name: Uranos
entities.description: Wounded by Kronos with a curved object, traditionally a knife.

entities.name: Mt. Olympos
entities.description: The battleground where Zeus and his allies fought during the Titanomachy.

entities.name: Mt. Orthrys
entities.description: Where the Titans, led by Kronos, battled against Zeus.

entities.name: Tartaros
entities.description: The prison for the defeated Titans, guarded by the Hekatoncheires.

entities.name: Atlas
entities.description: Tasked with holding up the sky following the defeat of the Titans.

entities.name: Prometheus
entities.description: Ally of Zeus during the Titanomachy, later involved in negotiations with Zeus according to various legends.

entities.name: Themis
entities.description: Ally of Zeus during the Titanomachy.

entities.name: Styx
entities.description: Allied with Zeus alongside her brood.

entities.name: Titanomachy
entities.description: The ten-year battle between the Titans and the Olympians, led by Zeus.

entities.name: Santorin (Thera)
entities.description: A volcanic island with noted activity, potentially linked to the imagery of battles in mythology.
